intro: Mentzelia nuda var. subpinnatifida, commonly known as the naked mentzelia or slenderleaf mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow to greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. This variety is part of the Loasaceae family and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators in its native habitat.
